children.text: On December 2, 2021, we launched the Transforming Narratives of Gun Violence Initiative with a virtual event. The event featured Congresswoman Ayanna Pressley, City Councilor Andrea Campbell, our partners from MGH and the Louis D. Brown Peace Institute, and performances by local artists. Over 270 individuals from Boston and beyond participated.
Check out our highlight reel from the event

Watch the full launch event with featured guest, Congresswoman Ayanna Pressley. Meet our partners, hear from advocates in the field, enjoy performances by local artists, and learn how this collaborative initiative is modeling a new approach to public problem solving in Boston.
Our December 2nd Launch Event featured performances by local artists Breezy Bodden, Willington Vuelto, and Caleb McCoy from Teen Empowerment Studios.

Caleb McCoy (@oakboymccoy) is a Bostonian rapper, musician and producer who has branded his style as OAK music. The OAK, or the One of A Kind, is a commitment to artistry with a message that is deep rooted, unique, and prolific. Caleb is also the Marketing Manager at the Emmanuel Gospel Center, where he highlights the social impact of leaders in Boston". Caleb’s latest album, Render Unto Caesar, is available on all digital platforms. To learn more, click here.
